intro: Synotis brunneovillosa, commonly known as the brown-hairy synotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, brownish stems and broad, ovate leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Synotis brunneovillosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
